intro: Nassauvia acanthifolia, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the plant is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Nassauvia acanthifolia is often found in rocky soils and can tolerate drought conditions.
